Instructions

Welcome to Zerocater's frontend screening exam! We ask that you build a table representing user data in React.

Setup

  1. Click Fork at the bottom right to create a copy of this question
  2. Now build your solution, run as many times as you want to try your script. Once done, click Export > Zip at the bottom right and send us your Zip file.

Requirements:

  • Convert all user data fields into their own column
  • The default sorting for the table should be by user first name then last name
  • All columns should also be sortable where collisions are handled by the default sorting
  • Alternate sort direction if the sorted column is clicked again
  • Indicate which column is sorted and in which direction
  • Dates should be represented in the format Jan 1, 2020
  • Choose an icon from Material Icons and show that icon if a boolean column is true
  • Avoid importing additional JS libraries
Update the JS section in codepen with your solution. The target time for this app is 1 hour. Add any notes, issues you ran into, or general feedback under the "Notes" section. We are using Bulma and Material Icons to style this app so you don't have to worry about writing your own. User data can be grabbed from window.userData and is an array of objects with the following structure: 
  {
    id: 100,
    firstName: "Marianne",
    lastName: "Halvorson",
    company: "Yundt - Padberg",
    jobTitle: "Product Accountability Producer",
    state: "South Dakota",
    isSiteAdmin: false,
    dateJoined: "1990-04-17T05:58:29.564Z"
  }

Notes

Feedback? Implementation issues? Restaurant recommendations? Thoughts on tabs vs spaces?
